subject: Nutrition
title: What Our Ancestors Ate
description: One-minute skill: What Our Ancestors Ate.

hook.text: For 95% of human history, our ancestors ate whatever they could hunt or gather. There were no farms.

buildup.text: Early humans consumed wild plants, nuts, seeds, insects, and whatever animals they could catch.

discovery.text: Tooth analysis of ancient skeletons reveals that early humans had far less tooth decay than modern people.

twist.text: Our ancestors ate over 100 plant species per year. The average modern person eats fewer than 20.

climax.text: The human body evolved for dietary variety. Our modern dependence on a few staple crops is abnormal.

punchline.text: We eat less variety now than at any point in history.

quiz.question: How many plant species did our ancestors eat yearly?
